#Text=Live with Meaning in a World Without Purpose

#Text=First introduced by philosopher Soren Kierkegaard , and later discussed by philosophers such as Friedrich Neitzche and Jean-Paul Sartre the idea of existentialism is a simple one : Human existence is not , does not have an objective purpose .
#Text=Instead , meaning for life must be made by the individual and is entirely subjective .
#Text=In order to accomplish this goal of creating meaning in a purposeless world , there are a few important steps , which will be described in this wikiHow .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Understand that life has no objective purpose .
#Text=Philosopher

#Text=Jean-Paul Sartre established the idea that existence precedes essence , which means essentially that humans existed before any meaning to life was thought to have existed , therefore he claims meaning is not given objectively .
#Text=Philosopher Viktor

#Text=Frankl created a theory in philosophy of Logotherapy which states that one must understand first , that our main motivation in life is to find meaning , because life is inherently meaningless and that we have inalienable freedom to find meaning .
#Text=Both theories are grounded in the notion that in order for something to have an objective purpose it must have been created with that purpose in mind .
#Text=For example , a hammer is created with the purpose of hammering nails and therefore its essence precedes its existence .
#Text=Existentialists believe this is not the case with humans and therefore , there is no objective purpose to life .
#Text=It is still possible to live a fulfilling life according to philosophers , and the first step to achieving this is to come to terms with the reality that life has no objective purpose .
#Text=Accept your freedom and personal responsibility .
#Text=According to Jean-Paul Sartre , existentialism requires one to take personal responsibility for their purpose and to actively use their freedom to make their purpose .
#Text=This presupposes that you possess free will , an idea accepted by most notable existentialists .

#Text=Another important component of choosing purpose freely is the existentialist notion of authenticity introduced by Soren Kierkegaard , which states that one must remain authentic by choosing a purpose which is true to themselves and their own desires and passions .
#Text=Therefore one must embrace their own personal responsibility and choose their purpose freely and authentically .
#Text=Understand that death is unavoidable .
#Text=If you can recognize deaths inevitability it will help you appreciate your life , and add extra importance and meaning to your actions .
#Text=According to existentialist philosopher , Martin Heidegger an awareness of death and mortal fragility gives allows authentic existence , a crucial component of existentialism , to be possible .
#Text=Furthermore , philosopher

#Text=Karl Jaspers argues that if one is unable to face the inevitable reality of death he will either resort to mythical beliefs to avoid death , or immerse himself in worldly things neglecting his need to form his own meaning .
#Text=Find your own purpose in your life .
#Text=Because there is no objective meaning or purpose to your life , according to existentialists , you must find your own .
#Text=Whether it is in helping other people , becoming the best in your career you can possibly be , all that matters is that you find a purpose which gives meaning to your life .
#Text=In the words of Jean-Paul Sartre :
#Text=“ Life has no meaning a priori …
#Text=It is up to you to give it a meaning , and value is nothing but the meaning that you choose . ”
